comment: Hotter than expected. Tasted on the mid-tongue, lingers a bit on the front of the tongue. Continues the finish I to the back of the tongue with some spiciness. Nice strong bourbon smell, can definitely smell the raisins and mint.
Good balance of bourbon and rye, but not as good as it's daddy, Bourye.
Amazing blend. Like all High West, incredible flavor and smoothness.
You can enjoy this, sitting on the couch with just a drop of water - and come back to explore a little more each time. Far from two-dimensional, nice herbal flavors and a bit of a bite.
Sweet and complex. I like the "baking spices" finish.

Son of Bourye is awesome. I have a bottle in my cabinet right now. There's a somewhat sweet, woody vanilla flavor to it that I know comes from the bourbon. That's complimented by a nice kind of spiciness from the rye. It's a great, versatile whiskey.
Spicy, mint a little fire ball cinnamon thing going on. I'm for it
Very smooth and budget friendly. Would definitely get this again.
spicy with cinnamon, very smooth front to back with no bite, can definitely taste a mintiness, medium body at least, easy drinker
Tricky to nail down; marble rye bread meets smooth, dry bourbon. Great spirit, fun to decipher!
Cinnamon and mint. Heavy on vanilla.  Spicy but still very smooth. Nice lingering finish.

Tasted 12/17/2014 : Rye nose of spice and mint added with vanilla/honeysuckle sweetness with baking chocolate.  Sweet and spice perfectly balanced with a creamy, full texture which finishes the same way, though not as long as I wished.  This is  perfect for sipping on a cold night by a fire after skiing.  Need to add to my collection.
Being from CO, I love seeing stuff from the West. But this wasn't my cup of tea, bot really into Ryes. That said, add just a bit of water and this is pretty amazing stuff.
One ice cube really mellows this out. Great every day sipper.
Nice blend of bourbon and Rye flavors that comes on with plenty of ethanol heat. Lots of caramel, some vanilla, nice except for the burn.
This stuff is great. I am not into rye whiskey but the bourbon definitely mellows out the spice in the rye to create a complex flavor profile.
Nice. But a little sweet and the rye comes through.
anise, red hots, juicy fruit gum, vanilla, hint of cigar box, toasted apples, leather. Very good. [86]
Nice neat but water or ice really flattens it out. A bit of spice making it a safe intro to someone wanting a sweet introduction to rye. The nose reminded me of a small bakery.
Didn't like nearly as much as Campfire. Perhaps the lack of smoke or just a less full flavor. Wouldn't seek out this one.
The bar called this son of bourbon but it's really rye.
This one has more cinnamon notes than their others. Still smooth as a baby's ass

High west. Thank you. You don't care what traditional whiskey drinkers think and because of that, I got into the liquid gold. I love their blends and this is such a good mix of spice and some smoky flavor. Bourye has been out of stock until recently so I've been enjoying this gem.  Drinking high west makes me think of camping, being by a fire, just all the good things that come with a having a glass of whiskey outdoors.
complex and better than the distiller score i feel

Spicy. I prefer Double Rye instead of this Double Rye & Bourbon blend. That said, I'd like to try the older Bourye, as that may mellow it out and add some complexity. I suggest skipping this and going with Bourye, or even Double Rye, though I would suggest skipping straight to Rendezvous Rye since even that is pretty spicy and lacks complexity, especially since Rendezvous is supposed to be one of the all-time best ryes.

Many thanks to @RichardofModernDrinking for this sample.  I'm a huge fan of High West.  I think it's one of the few craft distilleries that actually create a sum of something greater than the individual components.  Now that they've been bought by a bigger spirits company, it'll be interesting to see if those talents can be more widely taken, or will it fizzle out.   This one had a nose of mint and eucalyptus, classic rye aromas...but, a bit subdued from the bourbon's vanilla and caramel.  I was expecting the taste to be a conflict between the rye's mint and the bourbon's vanilla, but it was rather well done...the bourbon backbone played well with the rye upfront.  It's good...but personally, I'd rather have the bourbon or the rye, not both together.  It's maybe me personally rather than a representation of this blend.  Out of the hundreds of ways High West could've screwed this up, fortunately they found the one way to make it work right.   Thanks Richard for this!
Splashed a little more water than I meant to. Opened up massively. Lots of sweet caramel and toffee notes with some nice spice.
This was one of my first whiskeys and was a staple for me. Great flavor and great price. Too bad they discontinued this one. Most of the other High West blends are worth while.
MGPI sourced whiskey and mixed by HW, but they do it well (pricey!). Good spicy rye content behind the fruit.
Dark fruit, vanilla, very sweet, oaky after notes, alcohol on the nose, with fruits
Pear and sweetness on the nose, full and oily body
